image.altText: Man depressed

props.synopsis: Men make up more than 75 per cent of all suicide deaths in Australia, but Lifeline says they only make up about 40 per cent of helpline service users — and even when men do seek help they experienced "high levels of disengagement".

title.children: Inquiry into male suicide rates hears men report feeling 'invisible'

image.altText: A man sitting in a paddock of weeds.

props.synopsis: To the untrained eye, African lovegrass is just another plant in the NSW Snowy Mountains. But this golden plant is a deceptive invasive weed that is choking out the landscape, causing some farmers to leave the land.

title.children: Farmers call for change as invasive weed chokes out landscape

image.altText: Outside the ACT Fire and Rescue South Tuggeranong.

props.synopsis: The baby boy — estimated to be less than 24 hours old — was found Thursday morning outside a fire station.

title.children: Police concerned for mother after newborn baby found outside fire station

image.altText: A close up of a goanna's face.

props.synopsis: One of a handful of Rosenberg’s goannas living in the ACT’s hill reserves has once again wandered off, prompting calls from a local conservation organisation for help bringing him back.

title.children: Rare goanna missing again from Canberra reserve

image.altText: a herd of horses eating and grazing

props.synopsis: A widely criticised bill recognising the heritage value of wild horses in Kosciuszko National Park will be scrapped in a move celebrated by the Invasive Species Council.

title.children: Controversial 'Brumby Bill' recognising horses' heritage value dumped

image.altText: Two people wearing dark blue scrubs walk away from the camera through a modern-looking hospital building.

props.synopsis: They were treated as "heroes and angels" during the pandemic years, but the number of occupational violence incidents against healthcare workers and staff working in Canberra's Health Services is steadily increasing, new documents reveal.

title.children: Increase in occupational violence against health staff and nurses

image.altText: Macquarie Point stadium

props.synopsis: Since its inception, the stadium project has divided the Hobart community in a tug of war between development and preservation of its historic waterfront. In just days, the door will shut forever on one side of the debate.

title.children: Hobart's future will be decided in just days as the city holds its breath

image.altText: One woman wearing a yellow t-shirt and one woman wearing a pink t-shirt smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: As the crypto sector expands its appeal beyond tech insiders, the gamification of cryptocurrencies is appealing to younger users, which experts warn is walking the line between gaming and gambling.

title.children: The crypto crazes walking the line between gaming and gambling

image.altText: Confetti flies behind the North Melbourne Kangaroos as they celebrate with the AFLW premiership trophy.

props.synopsis: North Melbourne proves to be ground breakers and history makers as it extend its match-winning streak to 27 games in a comprehensive win over Brisbane.

title.children: Kangaroos make history in the books and on the field in flag defence

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump wearing a suit and red tie.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says the entire airspace above the South American nation of Venezuela should be considered closed in its entirety.

title.children: Trump says airspace above and surrounding Venezuela to be closed

image.altText: McLaren F1 driver Oscar Piastri puts his hand on his head, wearing a cap, as he smiles after qualifying at the Qatar Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Australian driver Oscar Piastri is doing everything he can to catch McLaren teammate Lando Norris in the world championship race, winning the sprint race and qualifying in pole position for the Qatar Grand Prix.

title.children: Piastri's perfect day sees him edge closer to teammate in F1 championship

image.altText: Close up of man in suit with curly grey hair

props.synopsis: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation, with multiple awards for his work on stage and screen.

title.children: Playwright and Oscar winner Tom Stoppard dies at 88

image.altText: Debris and rubbish piled into the street

props.synopsis: Thailand’s Health Ministry estimates that more than 160 people were killed in the disaster across nine provinces, but at least 110 of those died in Songkhla, where Hat Yai is the capital.

title.children: Thai PM admits flood failures after trapped victims wait days for help

image.altText: Three men in suits and ties and a woman sit at a table.

props.synopsis: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and special envoy Steve Witkoff will meet with Ukrainian negotiators in Florida for talks on a deal to end Russia's war in Ukraine, a senior US official says.

title.children: Rubio, Witkoff to meet Ukraine delegation, US official says

image.altText: Hundreds of flies gather on a feeding area.

props.synopsis: Researchers on Kangaroo Island have been breeding and releasing millions of sterile Australian sheep blowflies in an attempt to eradicate the pest.

title.children: Sterile flies take to the sky in Kangaroo Island eradication push

image.altText: A woman wearing a swimsuit in the ocean with a CGM scanner visible on her stomach.

props.synopsis: We spoke to six people with three different types of diabetes to find out what they wish more of the public knew. Here's what they had to say.

title.children: The things people with diabetes want you to be aware of

image.altText: The band 5 Seconds of Summer sit together wearing black and red clothing against a white background.

props.synopsis: Sensitive song-smiths, reinvented boy bands, rock and rap upstarts — it's all here in an Ausmusic Month edition of the best new music.

title.children: The 10 albums our critics couldn't stop listening to in November

image.altText: People throw hands in air partying

props.synopsis: With countries like Australia still debating whether or not the time has come to become a republic, what prompted tiny Barbados with its population of less than 300,000, to take the leap?

title.children: Why tiny Barbados said goodbye to the royal family

image.altText: An underground rail station.

props.synopsis: It's the biggest upgrade to Melbourne's rail network in more than 40 years, and it's arrived — the long-awaited Metro Tunnel, along with its five new inner-city stations, opens to the public on Sunday.

title.children: Melbourne's Metro Tunnel opens today. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: The tail of a Jetstar aircraft showing its name an livery

props.synopsis: About 90 Jetstar flights have been cancelled across Australia today due to a global recall of Airbus A320 planes for urgent software repairs.

title.children: Global recall of Airbus A320s throws world's airlines into disarray

image.altText: Map of Sunda and Sahul, with arrows showing potential migration routes.

props.synopsis: A new genetic study has found Indigenous Australians travelled via two distinct routes 60,000 years ago to reach the ancient landmass that would become Australia.

title.children: DNA study provides 'almost perfect correlation' for first Australians' arrival

image.altText: Blue Wiggle Anthony dancing in the background with musician Keli Holiday at the front

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for the group says the band "does not condone" the use of drugs after a since-deleted video promoting Keli Holiday's single, Ecstasy, appeared on social media.

title.children: Wiggles issue statement after appearing in Keli Holiday Ecstasy video

image.altText: Jacinta Allan looks serious at an outdoor press conference.

props.synopsis: On paper, Labor should be confident that it will score an unprecedented fourth term in office when Victorian voters go to the ballot box in a year's time, with the Liberal opposition still scrambling to present as an electable alternative.

title.children: A year out from Victoria's election, the Liberal Party has a mountain to climb

image.altText: A woman in a bucket hat posing for a photo.

props.synopsis: Queensland is becoming the first jurisdiction in Australia to allow specialist GPs to diagnose ADHD in adults and prescribe treatment, but some hold concerns about the lack of mandatory specific training.

title.children: Concerns over lack of specific training in ADHD for GPs amid care reforms

image.altText: Two men in their 40's holding beer

props.synopsis: The QLD Premier has declared a crushing LNP victory in a KAP stronghold, after a bitterly contested by-election campaign.

title.children: Queensland Premier claims LNP victory over KAP in bitterly-contested by-election

image.altText: Woman with brown hair, brown top and black blazer.

props.synopsis: Nilupulie Karunaratne thought asking for help was a sign of weakness. Then her husband referred her to a psychologist.

title.children: Before experiencing postpartum depression, this mother had never heard of it

image.altText: A fire engine and emergency services personnel work to free a woman from a cave.

props.synopsis: A 60-year-old woman survives a 12-hour ordeal after falling into a cave in remote Western Australia, prompting a large rescue effort in the Goldfields.

title.children: Woman rescued after eight-metre fall into cave in remote WA

image.altText: Toni Lamond to get lifetime achievement award

props.synopsis: Australian screen and stage actor Toni Lamond was known for her roles in Annie Get Your Gun, My Fair Lady, Number 96 and The Last Frontier.

title.children: Legendary vaudeville performer Toni Lamond dies aged 93

image.altText: Two halves of a mango on a chopping board.

props.synopsis: What's the difference between a big R2E2, a delicate Honey Gold, and an iconic Kensington Pride? Find out before biting into a mango this season.

title.children: Fancy a sweet, juicy mango? Here's all you need to know about them

image.altText: A digitally blended composite image comprised of people and the RBA

props.synopsis: Hotter-than-expected inflation figures have caught most economists and policy makers off guard. The ongoing price pressures in the economy open the door for an RBA interest rate hike in 2026.

title.children: The RBA's likely next interest rate move has surprised just about everyone

image.altText: A graphic showing multiple Qantas planes lined up along the tarmac at Melbourne Airport.

props.synopsis: A fire that forced the evacuation of Melbourne's Qantas domestic terminal on Friday night continues to be investigated.

title.children: Investigation continues into Melbourne Airport fire

image.altText: A jumping castle flipped on the ground

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a property in Bradfield following reports a jumping castle had flown into the air with people onboard.

title.children: Five children injured after jumping castle flies into air in Sydney's west

image.altText: Four national guard members patrol outside the Lincoln memorial.

props.synopsis: Less than 24 hours after the shooting, Trump officials began ordering widespread reviews of immigration policies.

title.children: US halts all asylum claims following shooting of two National Guard troops

image.altText: Josh Giddey confronts a spectator during an NBA game.

props.synopsis: A frustrated Josh Giddey has an altercation with a spectator during the Chicago Bulls' 123-116 loss to the Charlotte Hornets.

title.children: Giddey involved in heated row with NBA courtside spectator

image.altText: A cricketer in green plays a scoop shot

props.synopsis: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning hits 73 not out to help the Stars to a convincing 45-run derby victory over the Renegades, while the Hurricanes down the Scorchers.

title.children: Lanning fires again as Stars blitz Renegades, Hurricanes down Scorchers
